summary: Designed and developed 'ITC Hub' as a comprehensive internal platform donation.
description: Architected and built 'ITC Hub' as a donation project intended for the club. I handled the entire software engineering lifecycle, from system design and database architecture to full-stack implementation using Next.js and TypeScript. Key achievements include designing a complex relational database schema with Prisma, implementing Role-Based Access Control (RBAC), and creating a responsive UI. Although the project was not ultimately adopted, it demonstrated enterprise-level development capabilities.
projects: ITC Hub - Internal communication and management platform

summary: Developing web and desktop applications, delivering client projects, and building open-source tools.
description: As a Junior Software Engineer, I deliver high-quality web solutions for clients, such as the 'Mosquito Killer DZ' landing page and 'Remdani Dental Center' website. I also build complex tools like 'COD Simulation' for e-commerce analytics and 'C-Studio', a desktop IDE. My stack includes Next.js, React, and TypeScript, with a focus on performance and user experience.
projects: Mosquito Killer DZ - High-conversion landing page
C-Studio - Desktop IDE for C programming

summary: Collaborating on club projects and mentoring members.
description: Active contributor to the club's digital presence. Collaborated on the official ITCP website and the 'ITC Talks' event platform. I also participate in mentoring sessions and technical workshops.

summary: Contributed to the development of the CSE Hub.
description: Worked as a Frontend Developer on the 'CSE Hub' project. Collaborated closely with UI/UX designers to implement pixel-perfect interfaces using React and Vite. This was my first major team-based software engineering project.
